meanings.definition: Used for emphasis or to express annoyance or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Blankety! I can't believe I forgot my lunch again.
meanings.sent2: Oh, blankety! I dropped my phone and cracked the screen.
meanings.sent3: Blankety me, I missed the bus by just a few seconds.
meanings.sent4: The blankety rain ruined our picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: She shouted 'blankety' when she stubbed her toe on the table.

meanings.sent1: The blankety sky was a dull gray all day.
meanings.sent2: The room felt so blankety without any decorations.
meanings.sent3: His blankety response to the exciting news was disappointing.
meanings.sent4: The blankety painting failed to capture anyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The blankety landscape seemed to drain all color from the world.

meanings.definition: A piece of cloth used to cover something.
meanings.sent1: She draped a blankety over the old armchair to protect it.
meanings.sent2: The baby held onto the soft blankety for comfort.
meanings.sent3: He used the blankety to hide the surprise gift from his sister.
meanings.sent4: The magician pulled a rabbit out of the blankety during the show.
meanings.sent5: The blankety smelled of fresh laundry and warmth on a cold night.
